meanings.definition: A drink made by mixing beer with lemonade or other non-alcoholic beverage.
meanings.sent1: At the picnic, I enjoyed a refreshing shandy in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The pub down the street serves a delicious shandy.
meanings.sent3: The shandy was so tasty, it felt like a party in my mouth.
meanings.sent4: The shandy danced on my taste buds like a summer breeze.
meanings.sent5: The golden shandy sparkled in the glass like liquid sunshine.

meanings.definition: A person who is easily influenced or manipulated.
meanings.sent1: She's such a shandy, always agreeing with others.
meanings.sent2: He became a shandy in the hands of the con artist.
meanings.sent3: The shandy followed the crowd like a lost puppy.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a shandy, swayed by every passing thought.
meanings.sent5: He was a shandy, bending to the will of those around him.
